text: The following factors could affect Italian markets on Monday.Reuters has not verified the newspaper reports, and cannot vouch for their accuracy. New items are marked with (*).For a complete list of diary events in Italy please click on .POLITICSItalys government will decide by July whether to ask for a loan from the European Stability Mechanism (ESM) bailout fund to help relaunch its coronavirus-battered economy, Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte told various newspapers.COMPANIESATLANTIAThe Italian infrastructure group swung to a net loss in the first quarter as the impact of the coronavirus crisis compounded fallout from a prolonged political dispute over its motorway concession.The government will take a decision on the disputed motorway concession of Atlantias unit Autostrade per lItalia in a week or two, Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte told La Repubblica.ASSICURAZIONI GENERALIItalys top insurer said on Thursday it had reached a settlement agreement with Brazilian bank BTG Pactual to end a dispute over the sale of Swiss private bank BSI. Generali said it would pay BTG Pactual 245 million Swiss francs ($260 million) by way of compensation and price adjustment, with a net impact of around 183 million euros ($207 million) on its 2020 first half results.UNICREDIT, INTESA SANPAOLOItalys antitrust authority said it was probing four financial institutions, including the countrys top banks Unicredit and Intesa Sanpaolo, for allegedly withholding information and imposing unnecessary conditions on borrowers who wanted to access coronavirus support measures.INTESA SANPAOLO, BPER BANCA, UBI BANCAItalian market watchdog Consob is set to approve the offer document of Intesas bid for rival UBI next week, Il Sole 24 Ore reported on Friday.Italys Intesa Sanpaolo is in talks to revise the terms of an accord to sell branches and assets to BPER Banca in order to overcome objections raised by Italys antitrust authority to its proposed takeover bid for rival UBI Banca, a source close to the matter said on Thursday.BPER is set to increase the number of Intesas branches it would buy to offset antitrust concerns, MF said.Intesa could raise by 100 units the number of branches to be sold to BPER and an agreement on the matter could be reached by Monday, Il Sole 24 Ore said.(*) FINCANTIERIThe government has approved the sale to Egypt of two warships made by shipbuilder Fincantieri, Corriere della Sera said.CATTOLICAA group of small investors at the Italian insurer created a shareholder pact, dubbed Le Api, in an attempt to block a 500 million euros capital increase required by Italys insurance regulator, MF daily reported on Friday.TELECOM ITALIAThe government is working on a plan to create a single national fiber optic network as a part of a recovery plan to relaunch its economy after the coronavirus crisis, Italian Prime Minister told papers on Friday.Italian State lender Cassa Depositi e Prestiti could increase its stake in Telecom Italia in the next few months to facilitate a plan to merge TIMs network assets with that of rival Open Fiber, MF daily reported on Friday.UBI BANCAThe Italian bank sold seven properties in Milan, realising a final gross gain of around 54 million euros.MONCLER - Italys luxury outwear maker said it had signed an agreement with Frances Interparfums to start selling perfumes, as it seeks to diversify its brand and lessen the deep impact of the coronavirus crisis on the luxury goods sector.(*) DIASORINThe company said it had CE marked its Simplexa Congenital CMV Direct kit, a new molecular diagnostic test that enables direct detection of cytomegalovirus DNA in both saliva swab and urine specimens from babies up to 21 days old, it said on Friday.(*) BANKSThe European Commission has given its green light to the 1.6 billion euro rescue plan for Banca Popolare di Bari, La Repubblica reported.ITALGASItalys biggest gas distributor said on Thursday that its core earnings could rise by as much as 8% this year as its digitalisation drive improves efficiency and mitigates the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.BANCA POPOLARE DI SONDRIOAnnual general meeting (0800 GMT).DIARYGoldman Sachs holds European Financials Virtual Conference live streaming with:* Bank
